Name: Zhanar
description:
Zhanar, 38, has been in animal husbandry over 15 years. She's married and has children. In 2007, she and her husband purchased three head of cattle. Currently, she manages a herd of 50 to 60 cattle, runs her own farm and employs a shepherd.

Together with her family, she produces dairy products and sells them to residents of nearby villages. Zhanar also sells livestock at the livestock market. Her products are known for their quality, freshness and affordability, earning her the trust of loyal customers.

A loan of KZT 1,500,000 will help Zhanar expand her farm and improve conditions for her livestock.

Her husband supports her in this endeavor, as the farm is a family business. Zhanar's main goal is development and expansion of her enterprise to ensure villagers always have access to fresh, natural products, and to provide a decent life for her children and loved ones.

Expanding her farm will not only benefit her and her family, but also contribute to the local economy by providing employment opportunities and a sustainable source of quality agricultural products. With determination and perseverance, Zhanar is paving the way for a brighter future for herself, her family and her community.
